get.description: List all analytics entries with pagination
List all training content in the pipeline with pagination

put.description: Updates/Creates corpus in the specified pipeline.

post.description: Process the given query using the specified pipeline
Search semantically the given query using the specified pipeline

schema.title: Response List Nlp Providers Admin Nlp Providers Get
Response List Vdb Collection Admin Vdb Collections Get
Response List Configurations Admin Config Get

max_messages.title: Maximum messages in history
max_messages.description: The max number of messages to keep in chat history per session

enabled.title: Determines if the chat history feature is enabled.

type.title: Translation Provider type
type.description: Must be set to CLASSIC to define a ClassicTranslationProvider

remote_glossaries.title: Set of remote glossaries URIs
remote_glossaries.description: Glossaries to use when invoking translation providers using a glossary. These glossaries, when available, are created at the provider's service. For example, see https://cloud.google.com/translate/docs/advanced/glossary

location.title: Translation provider location
location.description: The location of the translation provider. Required by Google Translation Service and defaults to global if not set.

need_training.title: Defines whether this Corpus Item needs training

model.title: Model
model.description: The model of the NLP Provider

providers.title: Providers
providers.description: List of NLPProvider configurations to use for generating embeddings

platform_url.title: Platform Url
platform_url.description: The API URL of the provider

model.title: Model
model.description: The model of the NLP Provider

seed.title: Seed
seed.description: If specified, some NLP Providers will make a best effort to sample deterministically.

article_format.title: Article format template
article_format.description: The template to use when constructing the training text that represents each article. Available placeholders include: title, group, body, tags and url

corpus_language.title: Language of the provided corpus
corpus_language.description: The language which we expect the corpus of the Pipeline

native_languages.title: Pipeline native languages
native_languages.description: A list of languages that are considered native to the LLMs and don't require translation

default_native_language.title: Default native language
default_native_language.description: This is the target language that is used when translating text that is a non-native language

return_confidence.title: Instruct the Pipeline to return a confidence score
return_confidence.description: If set to True, the Pipeline will return a confidence score for each response

type.title: Translation Provider type
type.description: Must be set to LLM to define a LLMTranslationProvider

model.title: The model of the NLP Provider

seed.title: LLM inference seed
seed.description: If specified, some NLP Providers will make a best effort to sample deterministically.

prompt.title: LLM translation prompt
prompt.description: A prompt to use for translations, when using an LLM as a translator

NLPPlatform.title: NLPPlatform
NLPPlatform.description: NLPPlatform is an enumeration of different Natural Language Processing (NLP) platforms.

NLPPlatformScope.title: NLPPlatformScope
NLPPlatformScope.description: Enum class representing the different scopes of NLP platforms.

name.title: Pipeline name
name.description: The name of the Pipeline. Does not have to be unique

tenant_id.title: Tenant id
tenant_id.description: Optionally provide an identifier of the tenant using this Pipeline

organization_id.title: Organization id
organization_id.description: Optionally provide an identifier of the organization that the tenant using this Pipeline belongs to

vdb_collection.title: Vector DB collection of this Pipeline.
vdb_collection.description: This is where where vectors of the corpus of this Pipelines are held.

status.title: The current status of the Pipeline
status.description: The status is set to INITIALIZED when the Pipeline is first created. During a training is set to TRAINING and after a successful training is set to TRAINED. If the training fails, the status is set to FAILED

created_at.title: The date when this Pipeline was created

updated_at.title: The date when this Pipeline was last updated

last_trained_at.title: The date when this Pipeline was last trained

last_used_at.title: The date when this Pipeline was last used

general_settings.title: General Pipeline settings
general_settings.description: Contains general configurations such as language settings and article format

translation.title: Language translation providers settings
translation.description: Contains configuration of translation providers that can be used when translations are needed within the various actions of this Pipeline

embeddings.title: Embeddings creation settings
embeddings.description: Contains configuration of embeddings providers that are used when vectorizing corpus or queries

semantic_search.title: Semantic Search settings
semantic_search.description: Contains configuration for the Retrieval phase of RAG (e.g. top-k)If set to null, this functionality is disabled.

text_generation.title: Configuration of the Text Generation phase of the Pipeline
text_generation.description: Contains configuration of LLM providers, the prompt to use, max_tokens, etcIf set to null, this functionality is disabled.

chat_history.title: Chat history configuration
chat_history.description: Contains settings for the local chat history, such as the number of messages to keep.If set to null, this functionality is disabled.

sem_cache.title: SemCache configuration
sem_cache.description: Contains settings for enabling Semantic Cache (experimental)If set to null, this functionality is disabled.

query_summarization.title: User query summarization configuration
query_summarization.description: Contains settings for enabling user query summarization. Query summarization (aka history reduction) uses the previous conversation to rewrite the last user message with more context from the previous messages. This technique can be used to enable history in RAG architectures, when queries may refer to previous answers.Works only in conjunction with chat history. If set to null, this functionality is disabled.

id.title: Pipeline unique identifier
id.description: If none is provided when creating a Pipeline, a random GUID type 4 is automatically generated

name.title: Pipeline name
name.description: The name of the Pipeline. Does not have to be unique

tenant_id.title: Tenant id
tenant_id.description: Optionally provide an identifier of the tenant using this Pipeline

organization_id.title: Organization id
organization_id.description: Optionally provide an identifier of the organization that the tenant using this Pipeline belongs to

vdb_collection.title: Vector DB collection of this Pipeline.
vdb_collection.description: This is where where vectors of the corpus of this Pipelines are held.If none is given (default) an existing collection is allocated to this Pipeline

PipelineStatus.title: PipelineStatus
PipelineStatus.description: Enum class representing the different statuses of a pipeline.

name.title: Pipeline name
name.description: The name of the Pipeline. Does not have to be unique

tenant_id.title: Tenant id
tenant_id.description: Optionally provide an identifier of the tenant using this Pipeline

organization_id.title: Organization id
organization_id.description: Optionally provide an identifier of the organization that the tenant using this Pipeline belongs to

status.title: The current status of the Pipeline
status.description: The status is set to INITIALIZED when the Pipeline is first created. During a training is set to TRAINING and after a successful training is set to TRAINED. If the training fails, the status is set to FAILED

providers.title: List of TextGenerationProvider to use for text generation

prompt.title: The prompt to use  when invoking the LLM

max_tokens.title: The maximum number of tokens to use when invoking the LLM

temperature.title: The temperature to use when invoking the LLM

parser.title: Query summarization parser
parser.description: The parser to use to extract the query summarization

hide_urls.title: Hide URLs when passing corpus to external service
hide_urls.description: When enabled, replaces urls with UUIDs before passing corpus to external service for text generation.

query.title: Query summarization query template
query.description: The template of the query to send sending the request to the LLM. Available placeholders: - {{dialog}}: the current dialog constructed using previous (history) messages

skip_history_in_inference.title: Skip history in inference
skip_history_in_inference.description: If query summarization is enabled and this property is set to True, the history of the dialog will not be used during inference

use_summary_in_sem_search.title: Use the query summarization in semantic search
use_summary_in_sem_search.description: If this property is set to True, the query summarization will be used during semantic search

use_summary_in_generation.title: Use the query summarization in generation phase
use_summary_in_generation.description: If this property is set to True, the query summarization will be used during text generation and will also be stored in history

enhance_sem_search_with_summary.title: Enhance semantic search with additional search based on summary
enhance_sem_search_with_summary.description: If this property is set to True, the query summarization will be used during Semantic Search to add additional k corpus items in the text generation context

enabled.title: Determines if the query summarization feature is enabled.

type.title: Defines a text type parser
type.description: TEXT parsers must also define a regular expression which will be used to extract the query summarization from the LLM response

regex.title: Regex to use when extracting the query summary from the LLM response
regex.description: The regex to apply when extracting the query summarization. If None is set, the default will be used: \s*user:\s?(.+)\s*

uri.title: Uri
uri.description: The Unique Resource Identifier for the glossary

need_training.title: Defines whether this Corpus Item needs training

enabled.title: Determines if the SemCache service should be used

api_key.title: The api key used to interact with the SemCache service

enabled.title: Determines if the semantic search feature is enabled.

visit_neighbors.title: Number of neighbors to visit during search (higher value = better accuracy, slower speed).

providers.title: List of TextGenerationProvider to use for text generation

prompt.title: The prompt to use  when invoking the LLM

max_tokens.title: The maximum number of tokens to use when invoking the LLM

temperature.title: The temperature to use when invoking the LLM

parser.title: The parser to use to extract information from the LLM response
parser.description: In RAG architectures, we typically need to extract the article id, and the generated text. The parser defined in this section allows the extraction of this information from the LLM response. This can be either a REGEX parser or a JSON. In both cases, the prompt must be configured in such a way that instucts the LLM to reply with a text that can be effectively parsed.

hide_urls.title: Hide URLs when passing corpus to external service
hide_urls.description: When enabled, replaces urls with UUIDs before passing corpus to external service for text generation.

type.title: Type
type.description: Defines a text type of LLMResponseParserConfiguration

regex.title: Regex
regex.description: The regex to apply when parsing the llm response. If None is set, the default will be used:\(ID:(.*?)\)([\s\S]*)

platform_url.title: Platform Url
platform_url.description: The API URL of the provider

model.title: Model
model.description: The model of the NLP Provider

seed.title: Seed
seed.description: If specified, some NLP Providers will make a best effort to sample deterministically.

query_translation_providers.title: The providers to use for translations of incoming messages
query_translation_providers.description: If more than one provider is configured, the service will use the next in the list when any error occurs while using one of them.

response_translation_providers.title: The provider to use for translations of responses
response_translation_providers.description: If more than one provider is configured, the service will use the next in the list when any error occurs while using one of them.

corpus_translation_providers.title: The provider to use for translations of corpus
corpus_translation_providers.description: If more than one provider is configured, the service will use the next in the list when any error occurs while using one of them.

hide_urls.title: Hide URLs when translating
hide_urls.description: When enabled, replaces urls with UUIDs before processing translations. URLs are then restored after translation.

enabled.title: Determines if the translation feature is enabled.

TranslationPlatform.title: TranslationPlatform
TranslationPlatform.description: Enum class representing different supported translation platforms.
